revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = James Cunningham | image = Eat St.'s James Cunningham.jpg | alt = | caption = Cunningham in September 2012 | birth_name = | birth_date = <!-- {{Birth date and age|YYYY|MM|DD}} or {{Birth-date and age|Month DD, YYYY}} --> | birth_place = | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} or {{Death-date and age|Month DD, YYYY|Month DD, YYYY}} (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = | nationality = Canadian | other_names = | known_for = | occupation = }}
'''James Cunningham''' (born 1973 or 1974)<ref name=owe>{{cite news|url=http://www.canada.com/Generation+should+responsible+kids+financial+literacy/4237680/story.html|title=Generation Owe: who should be responsible for kids' financial literacy?|last=Laucius|first=Joanne|work=Canada.com|date=7 February 2011|accessdate=6 May 2011}}</ref> is a Canadian stand-up comedian and TV host.
He is the host of [[Food Network (Canada)|Food Network Canada]]'s and [[Cooking Channel]] US's ''[[Eat St.]]'', a TV show about North American [[street food]] that debuted in 2011. He initially auditioned for another show before being offered the job of hosting Eat St.<ref name=shortorder>{{cite news|url=http://blogs.miaminewtimes.com/shortorder/2011/05/eat_streets_james_cunningham_e.php|title=Eat Street's James Cunningham Searches for Miami Food Truck Girl|last=Doss|first=Laine|work=Short Order|publisher=Miami New Times|date=5 May 2011|accessdate=6 May 2011}}</ref>.Other television appearances include "Last Comic Standing" and "Just for Laughs."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.winnipegfreepress.com/arts-and-life/food/new-series-eat-st-captures-revolution-in-gourmet-food-says-host-119178534.html|title=New series 'Eat St.' captures 'revolution' in gourmet food, says host|last=Ahearn|first=Victoria|work=Winnipeg Free Press|date=4 April 2011|accessdate=6 May 2011}}</ref> He has also worked as a TV warm up act.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.canadaeast.com/entertainment/article/537325|title=Shining a spotlight on the crowd warmer, the 'unsung hero' of TV tapings|last=Ahearn|first=Victoria|work=The Canadian Press|date=12 January 2009|accessdate=6 May 2011}}</ref>
He wrote and hosts "Funny Money", a stage show designed to teach students about finance.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.canada.com/ottawacitizen/news/bustech/story.html?id=c6211306-6bf4-4f42-8b2c-5b837d1eeba2 |title=Funny money banks laughs |date=26 April 2008 |work=Ottawa Citizen |accessdate=6 May 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121110091320/http://www.canada.com/ottawacitizen/news/bustech/story.html?id=c6211306-6bf4-4f42-8b2c-5b837d1eeba2 |archivedate=10 November 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> He does over 300 stand-up performances a year, mostly "Funny Money".<ref name=crave/>
Cunningham was born in Toronto,<ref name=crave>{{cite news|url=http://www.craveonline.com/tv/interviews/167369-james-cunningham-of-qeat-stq-has-the-funny-and-the-food|title=Eat St.'s James Cunningham|last=Cox|first=Jennifer|work=Crave Online|date=4 May 2011|accessdate=6 May 2011}}</ref> where his father was an accountant. He studied drama and minored in finance at the [[University of Toronto]].<ref name=owe/>
